intro: Geniostoma deplanchei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Geniostoma deplanchei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
